subject: Re: About JunitReport
msgSnippet: Thank you very much. Er, you mean that I can get it by modifying css? Thanks. But I ve no idea about css. ... that ... what
messageBody:
Thank you very much.

Er, you mean that I can get it by modifying css?

Thanks.

But I've no idea about css.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "j_cumps" <j_cumps@...> wrote:
>
> Hitliubo,
>
> The type column shows:
> - The string you enter in your assertXXX() call.
> - Stack trace of Exceptions that are thrown during testing.
>
> Each JUnit assertXXX() method allows you to pass a text message as
> first parameter.
> This message will appear in the type column, if your assert fails.
>
> I don't think there is a standard option to write other text to
that
> column.
> You would have to write your own JUnitReport stylesheet to achieve
> this.
>
> Regards, Jan
>
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "hitliubo" <hitliubo@> wrote:
> >
> > Junitreport outputs serveral columns that contains:
> >
> > Class£¬ Name£¬ Status£¬ Type£¬ Time(s)
> >
> > But there's information in type column only assert failed.
> > Now I want to display some information I need in type column,
what
> > should I do?
> >
> > Thanks a lot.
> >
>
